Name: Golden Dawn
Ingredients: 30 ml Calvados / apple brandy / straight applejack
30 ml De Kuyper Apricot Brandy liqueur
Instructions: SHAKE first 5 ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. Carefully POUR grenadine into centre of drink so that it sinks to create a sunrise effect.
Review: Although it spoils the sunrise effect, this drink is less tart if the syrup lying on the bottom is stirred into the drink (or, better, included when shaking).
History: Created in September 1930 by Tom Buttery at the Berkeley Hotel, London and first published in William J. "Billy" Tarling's 1937 Café Royal Bar Book . There are now many versions of this classic cocktail (David Embury's The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks lists three), the above recipe is my favourite.
Nutrition: One serving of Golden Dawn contains 213 calories
